news.title: Can construction waste plant truly combat pollution in Lucknow?
news.para: According to data, Lucknow generates approximately 250 to 300 tonnes of C&D waste daily. However, only 100 to 150 tonnes—primarily from small-scale construction and home renovation activities—are collected on a regular basis.

news.title: Maharashtra labour department to crack down on agents fleecing construction workers in BOCW registration
news.para: The move came following reports of rampant exploitation at tehsil offices across the state, including a recent case from Junnar taluka in Pune district, where agents demanded up to Rs 1,000 per registration.

news.title: YEIDA to hire agency to audit infrastructure projects off Yamuna Expressway
news.para: Its duties will include setting up testing laboratories, collecting material samples, arranging tests and submitting detailed reports to YEIDA on a daily, weekly or monthly basis.

news.title: Gurugram civic body struggles to find agency to manage construction waste
news.para: In April, the corporation sought bids to remove 6 lakh metric tonnes of legacy waste from the city, attracting three bidders. However, none of these bidders satisfied the required eligibility conditions.

news.title: Mumbai: Notices issues to tenants to remove illegal extensions
news.para: The Mumbai Building Repairs and Reconstruction Board is now issuing warning notices to tenants in reconstructed RT buildings in its jurisdiction.

news.title: Mumbai: No relief for six defaulter flat buyers in Chembur project
news.para: ​Of the six flat purchasers, five sought a refund of certain amounts they paid as they wished to withdraw from the residential project in Chembur, and one wanted to continue but sought more time to pay.

news.title: NRI couple falls prey to realty fraud in Hyderabad, lose ₹10 crore
news.para: ​The NRI couple was told that the project — located in Bhairkhanpalle village of Rangareddy district — was being developed using the popular Japanese Miyawaki plantation method, over 150 acres.

news.title: UK's Warehouse REIT agrees to Blackstone's $635.35 million bid
news.para: Blackstone raised its bid to 489 million pounds in March but knocked off the sweetener, citing differing views on the value of an asset.

news.title: Westpac's RAMS falsified payslips for loan approvals: ASIC
news.para: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) said RAMS Financial Group, a Westpac subsidiary until the bank shuttered the business last year, engaged in widespread unlicensed conduct from June 2019 to April 2023.

news.title: Water harvesting in new constructions to be a must for building permission in Indore
news.para: As per the plans, water harvesting will be mandatory for larger buildings, while it will remain voluntary for smaller structures. This initiative aims to improve groundwater levels and avert potential water scarcity in the coming years, senior officials said.

news.title: Singapore's City Developments to sell office complex stake for $646 million
news.para: The South Beach complex in a central business district in Singapore includes retail space, a 34-storey office tower, and a 45-storey building housing a JW Marriott Hotel.

news.title: Incuspaze appoints Mayank Kaushik as COO and Kapil Poddar as CFO
news.para: Sanjay Choudhary, founder and CEO of Incuspaze said, "As we expand our footprint across India, fortifying our leadership team is essential to achieving operational excellence and strategic clarity."

news.title: Kalyan-Dombivli civic body cracks down on illegal constructions in Titwala
news.para: Under this action, KDMC demolished two illegal houses on Nadap Road in Titwala, another house in the same area, and two rooms in Shantabai Nagar.

news.title: Jaideep Ahlawat along with wife buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹10 crore
news.para: The purchased apartment features a carpet area of 1,950 sq ft (181 sq meter) and a built-up area of 2,341 sq ft (217.47 sq meter), according to the Inspector General of Registration (IGR) documents reviewed by Square Yards.

news.title: Mumbai: Kurla dairy land will be used for ineligible Dharavi residents’ rehabilitation
news.para: ​In a press release, the govt said 8.5 lakh people are to be rehabilitated under the project, of whom five lakh will be rehabilitated in Dharavi and 3.5 lakh outside the Dharavi Notified Area (DNA).

news.title: Haridwar locals struggle to sell properties near waste site where civic body bought land at inflated rate
news.para: Villagers were shocked to learn that the Haridwar Nagar Nigam purchased the land for Rs 54 crore, even as they themselves struggle to sell their properties, despite slashing prices, due to the foul odour and polluted air from the dumping site.

news.title: Sambalpur civic body partners with SPA for urban development
news.para: The MoU signed under the guidance of Union education minister Dharmendra Pradhan aims to leverage SPA Delhi's expertise in transforming Sambalpur into a model city.

news.title: Houses outside lal dora in Chandigarh to get water connections but at a hefty price
news.para: ​According to the opposition, water connections should be provided without imposing double domestic charges and construction charges on old buildings. Regardless of their protests, the mayor and BJP councillors approved the agenda.

news.title: Pay your holding tax by June 30, avail up to 10% rebate: Ranchi civic body
news.para: "The RMC has collected Rs 22 crore in holding tax payments for the financial year 2025–26, achieving 23% of its annual target of Rs 97 crore," deputy municipal commissioner Gautam Prasad Sahu said.

news.title: About 300 revenue officers in Odisha issued show-cause notices for land sale norms flout
news.para: "Officers who were on DSR duty between 2014 and 2024 and indulged in illegal activities are facing disciplinary proceedings. Some of them even faced criminal charges and are in jail," revenue minister Suresh Pujari said.
